answers.answer: Hi,first things first.your A1C is too high.  Ideally it should be < 6.5.  Are you on medication for this?  You need to work with your doctor to agressively manage the diabetes.  This means getting to and maintaining optimal weight, exercise, lower carb diet, and medications as necessary.Did the doctors test any other thyroid tests than AntiTPO? This test can't tell us much if it is onlly tested by itself.  It simply means that there are some antithyroid antibodies present.Next step, if it hasn't been done already should be a fully thyroid panel, at least including TSH, FT3 and FT4.  With these tests your thyroid status can be better evaluated.  If you have these results already please post them along with the reference range, and then we can better comment / advise.hope this helps.

question: i am 44 and a diabetic type two  AC1 is 8.1 my anit tpo is 51 and should be 31. should i be worried cause i am freaking inside
title: assure me?
